titleStmt.title: It is this day ordered by the House of Commons, that the knights, citizens, and burgesses of the severall counties, cities, and boroughs of this kingdom, and the dominion of Wales ... shall forthwith signifie unto the commissioners appointed for the assessing and leavying of all summes of money to be raised by an act of Parliament intituled, An act for the speedie provision of money for disbanding the armies and setling the peace between the two kingdoms of England and Scotland
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Parliament. House of Commons.

titleStmt.title: It is this day ordered by the House of Commons, that the knights, citizens, and burgesses of the severall counties, cities, and boroughs of this kingdom, and the dominion of Wales ... shall forthwith signifie unto the commissioners appointed for the assessing and leavying of all summes of money to be raised by an act of Parliament intituled, An act for the speedie provision of money for disbanding the armies and setling the peace between the two kingdoms of England and Scotland
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Parliament. House of Commons.

publicationStmt.publisher: Imprinted at London by Robert Barker ... and by the assigns of John Bill,

notesStmt.note: Title from first seven lines of text.
Reproduction of original in the Bodleian Library.
